metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11712 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebCore/platform/network/soup/SocketStreamHandleImplSoup.cpp in the libsoup network backend of WebKit, as used in WebKitGTK+ versions 2.20.0 and 2.20.1, failed to perform TLS certificate verification for WebSocket connections.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8
